rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment provides a factual description of the case type ('first time a patient... has tested positive') without high-potency framing.
The verb 'tested positive' is not a moderate verb.
No loaded rhetorical question is present in the text.
The segment reports a fact about a case and milestone but does not contain explicit calming language.
The segment does not contain a minimiser used in conjunction with a scale contrast.
The segment contains a bare negation: 'did not work with any poultry or dairy farms'.
